verses.kjv: O LORD God of my salvation, I have cried day and night before thee:
verses.ct: LORD God of my salvation, I have cried out to you day and night.

verses.kjv: Let my prayer come before thee: incline thine ear unto my cry;
verses.ct: Let my prayer reach you; please listen to my desperate plea.

verses.kjv: For my soul is full of troubles: and my life draweth nigh unto the grave.
verses.ct: My soul is overwhelmed with troubles, and my life is slipping toward the grave.

verses.kjv: I am counted with them that go down into the pit: I am as a man that hath no strength:
verses.ct: People already consider me among those going down to the pit; I am like someone with no strength left.

verses.kjv: Free among the dead, like the slain that lie in the grave, whom thou rememberest no more: and they are cut off from thy hand.
verses.ct: I am abandoned among the dead, like the killed who lie in the grave â€” those you no longer remember, those who are separated from your care.

verses.kjv: Thou hast laid me in the lowest pit, in darkness, in the deeps.
verses.ct: You have placed me in the deepest pit, in darkness, in the depths.

verses.kjv: Thy wrath lieth hard upon me, and thou hast afflicted me with all thy waves. Selah.
verses.ct: Your anger presses down hard on me, and you have crushed me with wave after wave. Selah.

verses.kjv: Thou hast put away mine acquaintance far from me; thou hast made me an abomination unto them: I am shut up, and I cannot come forth.
verses.ct: You have driven everyone I know far away from me; you have made me repulsive to them. I am trapped with no way out.

verses.kjv: Mine eye mourneth by reason of affliction: LORD, I have called daily upon thee, I have stretched out my hands unto thee.
verses.ct: My eyes are worn out from suffering. LORD, I call out to you every single day; I reach my hands toward you.

verses.kjv: Wilt thou shew wonders to the dead? shall the dead arise and praise thee? Selah.
verses.ct: Do you perform miracles for the dead? Will the dead rise up and praise you? Selah.

verses.kjv: Shall thy lovingkindness be declared in the grave? or thy faithfulness in destruction?
verses.ct: Will your faithful love be proclaimed in the grave? Will your faithfulness be declared in the place of destruction?

verses.kjv: Shall thy wonders be known in the dark? and thy righteousness in the land of forgetfulness?
verses.ct: Will your wonders be recognized in the darkness? Will your righteousness be known in the land where everything is forgotten?

verses.kjv: But unto thee have I cried, O LORD; and in the morning shall my prayer prevent thee.
verses.ct: But I cry out to you, LORD; every morning my prayer comes to you.

verses.kjv: LORD, why castest thou off my soul? why hidest thou thy face from me?
verses.ct: LORD, why do you reject my soul? Why do you withdraw your favor from me?

verses.kjv: I am afflicted and ready to die from my youth up: while I suffer thy terrors I am distracted.
verses.ct: I have been suffering and near death since my youth; I have endured your terrors until I am overwhelmed.

verses.kjv: Thy fierce wrath goeth over me; thy terrors have cut me off.
verses.ct: Your burning anger sweeps over me; your terrors have destroyed me.

verses.kjv: They came round about me daily like water; they compassed me about together.
verses.ct: They surround me all day long like floodwaters; they close in on me from every side.

verses.kjv: Lover and friend hast thou put far from me, and mine acquaintance into darkness.
verses.ct: You have driven those I love and my friends far from me; darkness is my only companion.
